hero.title:
Where
travelersfind home.
hero.subtitle: A trail runner's base camp in the cloud-wrapped mountains of Dalat. Six local routes from the doorstep, 1,500m of altitude, and a team that speaks your language — whether that's vert, cà phê, or both.
video.label: Welcome to CP12
video.title: Feel it before you arrive.
video.desc: Three minutes through pine forests, misty mornings, and genuine human warmth. This is what Trạm CP12 feels like — before you even pack your bags.
video.tag: 3 min · Welcome Film by CP12 Team
rooms.label: Our Spaces
rooms.heading:
A room for every
kind of traveler.
rooms.intro: From intimate private rooms to our social dormitory — each space at Trạm CP12 is designed with intention. Natural materials, local craft, and exactly the kind of light that makes you want to stay another night.
explore.label: Explore Dalat
explore.heading: Trails, vert & hidden gems.
explore.card1.name: Hồ Xuân Hương
explore.card1.highlight: Active recovery done right. Start with an easy, crisp 5km shakeout run around the lake. At 1,500m elevation, a morning jog here hits different.
explore.card2.name: Vườn Hoa Thành Phố Đà Lạt
explore.card2.highlight: The city's iconic flower park overlooking Xuan Huong Lake. Features hundreds of flower species including hydrangeas, orchids, and roses perfectly curated.
explore.card3.name: Đỉnh núi Langbiang
explore.card3.highlight: 2,167m - The Roof of Da Lat. Skip the easy Radar Peak road to tackle the real 10.6km loop up Ba Mountain. That last 360m push with 717m total elevation gain tests every muscle.
explore.card4.name: Chợ đêm thành phố Đà Lạt
explore.card4.highlight: Swap your trail shoes for sandals. Replenish your calories with authentic bánh tráng nướng and hot soy milk in the chilly mountain air after a big hike.
explore.card5.name: Đồi chè Cầu Đất Đà Lạt
explore.card5.highlight: Dial in the vert for Dalat Ultra Trail! The 20.7-mile loop transitions from smooth dirt roads to technical rocky descents. Log 1,200m D+ before the heat hits.
explore.card6.name: Thiền viện Trúc Lâm Đà Lạt
explore.card6.highlight: Take the cable car up; earn the 4km pine-trail descent back to town. Fully runnable with switchbacks — time it early morning before tour groups hit the trail.
about.label: About CP12
about.heading:
Not just a bed.
A base camp.
about.p1: Trạm CP12 was born from a simple frustration: too many Đà Lạt stays felt like transactions. You'd arrive, sleep, leave — and miss the actual city entirely.
about.p2: We built something different. A place run by locals, designed for connection, and obsessively curated for solo travelers who want the real Đà Lạt — not the brochure version.
about.perk1.title: Local expertise, freely shared
about.perk1.desc: Hand-drawn route maps with elevation profiles, Strava segment tips, and hosts who've logged hundreds of km on these very trails.
about.perk2.title: Built for runners
about.perk2.desc: Breakfast before long runs, gear drying racks, cold-rinse station, and a recovery corner with muscle rub, and herbal teas.
about.perk3.title: Solo-traveler focused
about.perk3.desc: Free group trail runs during the week, sharing route information, and a dorm where runners naturally find each other.
journal.label: The CP12 Journal
journal.heading: Stories from the trail.
journal.subtext: Local insights, runner guides, hidden spots, and honest travel advice — straight from the CP12 team and the people who've stayed with us.
journal.card1.title: Dalat for Runners: Your Complete Trail Guide from Trạm CP12
journal.card1.excerpt: Dalat is trail running's best-kept secret in Southeast Asia — 1,500m altitude, cool air year-round, and 50km of singletrack within 30 minutes of CP12. Here's every route, graded.
journal.card2.title: How to Feel at Home at Trạm CP12
journal.card2.excerpt: There's a particular kind of freedom in traveling alone. Our dorm, morning walks, and weekly Trạm Nights are designed so connections happen naturally.
journal.card3.title: Dalat's Hidden Gems: Beyond the Tourist Trail
journal.card3.excerpt: Skip the brochures. Our team reveals hidden cafés, backstreet food stalls, and underground arts you won't find on TripAdvisor.
cta.label: Ready?
cta.title:
The mountains are
waiting.
cta.sub: Whether you're chasing trails, chasing peace, or just chasing a really good cup of cà phê — Trạm CP12 is ready for you. From 180,000 VND/night.
cta.step1.title: Message us
cta.step1.desc: Facebook, Zalo, email, or phone — we reply within 2 hours
cta.step2.title: Confirm your dates
cta.step2.desc: We hold your room with deposit required
cta.step3.title: Arrive & check in
footer.tagline: A trail runner's base camp in the mist-wrapped mountains of Đà Lạt — where solo travelers find their people, runners find their trails, and everyone finds a home away from home.
footer.bottom.made: Made with care in the Central Highlands
